comments.body: Why not just a devel.partial.Dockerfile and remove these lines and pull from ubuntu.partial.Dockerfile?

I made it like this to have symmetry with the nvidia images. `nvidia` and `nvidia-devel` *need* to be separate because some of the images they install are mutually exclusive. I think it could be confusing if the pattern was different between the CPU and GPU images, although its current state *is* somewhat redundant.

That is, the spec definitions would look like this, which would get confusing if I were reading it:

- cpu-devel:
   - ubuntu
   - ubuntu-devel
   - devel-stuff
- gpu-devel:
   - nvidia-devel
   - devel-stuff

I think it could go either way, so this could definitely be changed by anyone updating the Dockerfiles later (e.g. it could be `[ubuntu-base, ubuntu-devel, ...]`)
Probably want to label this ubuntu1604-devel.partial.Dockerfile because the package list and names will change with 18.04.

That's a great idea, but I think relabeling should come later, after this design is implemented. The set of images here aren't meant to be perfect; just a re-implementation of the images we currently have.

This suggestion would be an excellent first fix for someone other than me (either an internal team member or an OSS developer!) to confirm that working with the design is easy to do.
